Detailed Description

Superclass of all routeable items.

Consists of two nodes, one in each end of the segment.

Definition at line 28 of file OldRouteableItem.h.

Reimplemented from OldItem.

Reimplemented in OldBusRouteItem, OldFerryItem, and OldStreetSegmentItem.

virtual OldNode* OldRouteableItem::createNewNode (  DataBuffer *  dataBuffer,
uint32  nodeID
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Create a new node.

The reason for this method is to make it possible for the subclasses to create subclasses to OldNode.

Warning:
Since the normal way of getting a "new" node is to ask the map for a pre-allocated one the members will not be deleted. This means that using this method to create the members will cause memory leak!
Parameters:
dataBuffer The data buffer containing the data for the new node.
nodeID The ID of the new node.
Returns:
The created node.

Reimplemented in GMSFerryItem, and GMSStreetSegmentItem.

OldNode * OldRouteableItem::getNodeFromID (  uint32  id  )  [inline]
 

Get one of the nodes when the node ID is supplied.

If the most significant bit is set, node 1 will be returned, otherwise node 0.

Parameters:
id The ID of the node to return.
Returns:
Pointer to the node indicated by the most significant bit in the id.

Definition at line 253 of file OldRouteableItem.h.

byte OldRouteableItem::getRoadClass (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Get the class of this road.

To be overridden by sub classes supporting road class. If not overridden, mainRoad is returned.

Returns:
The road class (i.e. the level)

Reimplemented in OldFerryItem, and OldStreetSegmentItem.

int  nodeNbr = 2
) 
 

Find out if this routeable item is connected to an other.

Parameters:
other The segment to look for connections with.
nodeNbr The node to check. If nodeNbr != 0 and nodeNbr != 1 it will check both nodes.
Returns:
True if this routeable item is connected to the other.

double OldRouteableItem::sqrDistanceFromFirst (  OldRouteableItem *  routeableItem  ) 
 

Get the distance from the first point of this segment to an other.

Returns:
Squared distance from first point in this street segment to last end-point in the other one. Does not work where Earth cannot be approximated with a plane. Returns -1 if gfxData was NULL.

double OldRouteableItem::sqrDistanceFromLast (  OldRouteableItem *  routeableItem  ) 
 

Get the distance from the last point of this segment to an other.

Returns:
Squared distance from last point in this street segment to nearest endpoint in the other one. Only work when Earth can be linearized. Returns -1 if gfxData was NULL.

double OldRouteableItem::sqrFlightDistance (   ) 
 

Get the distance between the first and the last point of this steet segment.

Returns:
The squared distance between first and last point.

Do not delete the string.

The OldRouteableItem as a string

Reimplemented from OldItem.

Reimplemented in OldBusRouteItem, OldFerryItem, and OldStreetSegmentItem.

virtual bool OldRouteableItem::updateAttributesFromItem (  OldItem *  otherItem,
bool  sameMap = true
)  [virtual]
 

Virtual method that updates all attributes of item and, if any, its nodes and connections to the values of the other item.

This includes e.g. names, groups, entry restrictions, sign posts, speed limit and gfxdata. For more documentation see OldItem.h.

Parameters:
otherItem The item from which to get update values.
sameMap Default true meaning that the items are one and the same (same map), set to false if the items originates from different maps (e.g. underview and overview map)
Returns:
True if some attribute was updated for the item, false if not.

Reimplemented from OldItem.

Reimplemented in OldFerryItem, and OldStreetSegmentItem.
